description:
Our social meetups are always a blast! Come join us for some apps, drinks and great discussion. Help inspire some of that great conversation by posting some interesting articles or podcasts you've come across below so that we can share opinions and ideas! Please RSVP so we can ensure we have a space large enough to accommodate our group!

We are going to go checkout Brownstone Brewing (http://brownstonebrewing.com/), Tuesdays they offer Taps and Apps, $3 off Beer & Apps.
name: LI Web Social Meetup & Happy Hour

description:
What is Hacktoberfest?

Hacktoberfest—in partnership with GitHub—is a month-long celebration of open source software. Maintainers are invited to guide would-be contributors towards issues that will help move the project forward, and contributors get the opportunity to give back to both projects they like and ones they've just discovered. No contribution is too small—bug fixes and documentation updates are valid ways of participating. 2017 will mark the 4th year for Hacktoberfest!

Rules and Prizes

To participate, first sign up on the Hacktoberfest site . And if you open up four pull requests between October 1 and October 31, you'll win a free, limited edition Hacktoberfest T-shirt. (Pull requests do not have to be merged and accepted; as long as they've been opened between the very start of October 1 and the very end of October 31, they count towards a free T-shirt.)

More Details about Hacktoberfest can be found at: https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/

LI Web & SBCS Hacktoberfest Agenda

LI Web and the Stony Brook Computing Society are partnering to bring this online celebration offline.

7PM - Introduction To Hacktoberfest

We'll go over the basics of pull requests and discuss some projects that might be good candidates for new contributors.

7:15PM - Hacking Starts

9:30PM - Wrap Up

This event is for programmers of all ages and levels! We look forward to seeing you there!
name: Hacktoberfest Code Sprint Round 2

description:
Join us for a Co-Working Night on October 17th!

Co-Working nights are geared toward working on projects and collaborating with other Drupalists on challenges we may be facing.

Whether its setting up a new environment, developing a custom module, or just looking for some opinions on a build we are all here to help!

We have an AWESOME co-working space at LaunchPad Hunting.

Pizza and refreshments will be provided :)

Location:

LaunchPad Huntington
315 Main Street, 2nd Floor, Huntington, NY
Best parking is in the back off of Gerard St.

Date / Time: October 17th 7pm - 9pm

Looking forward to seeing everyone!
name: Long Island Drupal Co-Working Night- October 17th at Launch Pad Huntington

description:
LI Web is starting a Study Group!

The first topic will be "Getting Started with Angular 2". The content for this will be based off a video series on PluralSight.

Attendees will watch the recording together and then participate in a post-recording discussion and Q&A.

We will meet every other Thursday at 7PM at Stony Brook University (Room TBA).

Interested attendees will need to commit to attending the entire 5 meet-up series.

Dates: 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

Week 2 of 5: October 19, 2017 (54 minutes)
Templates, Interpolation, and Directives
Data Binding & Pipes


More Details:

https://gist.github.com/phantomtypist/f2fb662a493b9f1f103a4d4cffb7bf80
name: LI Web Study Group Week 2: Getting Started with Angular2

description:
This month we’ll be seeing a presentation of X2, a new Node.js framework created by Boyle Software (http://boylesoftware.com/blog/x2-framework-node-js/). X2 was designed to provide a complete toolset for creating back-end applications that expose RESTful APIs and are backed with a SQL database. Members of Boyle Software will be coming from NYC to give us a walkthrough and we’re all pretty excited.

We’ll also be holding a Q&A session afterwards. Bring any question you have about Javascript/Javascript frameworks!

Food and beverages will not be provided but there are plenty of great places to eat within walking distance. You are also welcome to bring food with you.
LaunchPad is located in downtown Huntington.

There is usually plenty of free parking in the rear parking lot as well as rear access to the building. Look for a glass door with the LaunchPad sign next to the Bon Bons Chocolatier and take the elevator up to the second floor.

If the front door is locked, please go to the rear door as it should always be unlocked.

We look forward to seeing you there!
name: JavaScript Monthly Meetup - X2 Node Framework Presentation/Javascript Q&A

description: October is National Cyber Security Awareness Month, I have reached out to a couple potential speakers, but if you have a related presentation, we'd love to have you, please reach out to one of the organizers.
name: LI Web Presentation Night - Cyber Security

description:
Our monthly Meetup will cover all things JavaScript, from plain JavaScript, libraries and frameworks, JavaScript on the server and everything in between.

The Meetup will be divided into two segments:

1. Beginner (6:00-7:30 PM)

2. Advanced (7:30-9:00 PM)

We will post the agenda for this Meetup closer to the scheduled date.

Food and beverages will not be provided but there are plenty of great places to eat within walking distance. You are also welcome to bring food with you.
LaunchPad is located in downtown Huntington.

There is usually plenty of free parking in the rear parking lot as well as rear access to the building. Look for a glass door with the LaunchPad sign next to the Bon Bons Chocolatier and take the elevator up to the second floor.

If the front door is locked, please go to the rear door as it should always be unlocked. If you are still not able to get in, please call or text 631-432-4309.


We look forward to seeing you there!
name: JavaScript Monthly Meetup

description: We haven't touched on this topic too deeply yet, aiming to have a presentation on relational and NoSQL Databases. If anyone is interested in presenting, please let one of the organizers know.
name: LI Web Presentation Night November: Databases
